conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to calculate the magnitude of the induced electromotive force (EMF) in the rectangular coil as it rotates around the symmetry axis.
Identify the given values: Magnetic induction intensity B = 0.1 T, Number of turns n = 100, Side lengths l_AB = 0.2 m and l_BC = 0.5 m, Angular velocity ω = 100π rad/s.
Calculate the circumference of the circular path of the coil: Circumference = 2π × (l_BC / 2) = π l_BC.
Calculate the angular displacement of the coil: Angular displacement = ω × Time = 100π × Time.
Calculate the time taken for one complete rotation: Time = Circumference / Angular velocity = (π l_BC) / ω = (π × 0.5) / (100π) = 0.05 s.
Calculate the induced EMF: The induced EMF E is given by E = n × B × l_AB × ω.
Calculate the magnitude of the induced EMF: E = 200π V ≈ 632.8 V.
The final answer: The magnitude of the induced electromotive force is approximately 632.8 V.
